result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome Artrell Kirkwood

records.addlTxt:
11:30 AM Defendant Jerome Artrell Kirkwood appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Jerome Artrell Kirkwood.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosenthal received information in 22CF351 and 22CF397, waives reading and pleads not guilty in each file. Court accepts not guilty pleas. Attorney Rosenthal asks for a status in mid December and would like to address bond. State in agreement to proceed. Attorney Rosenthal asks for modification to $500 cash bail in 22CF397 and makes argument to modification. State is opposed to modification of cash bail. State reviews pending charges in MN right now. Defendant also has criminal history out of IL, OH and MS. Court finds $1,000 bail appropriate and denies motion for bail modification.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
Calling cases 22CF397, 22TR3137, 22TR3138, 22TR3139, 22TR3140, 22TR3141
10:14 AM Defendant Jerome Artrell Kirkwood in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Jerome Artrell Kirkwood.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. 
Attorney makes argument for bail modification; unable to post $1000.  may be able to post $500.  Notes that a significant amount posted in other files and made all court appearances in those files. Has been in the area for a year. Was in school and employed through community action.
State opposes any reduction in bail.  Reviews previous cases and cash posted. Pending MN charges, most of criminal history is in IL and OH. Has case in MS.  Other than crimes committed in WI do not see any other ties.  Has Duluth address.
Court reviews arguments, does not believe 10 days is significant enough to warrant a reduction in bail. Denies modification of bail. Sets for arraignment and STC.
Arraignment scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No use or possession of alcohol. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license.

3:14 PM Defendant Jerome Artrell Kirkwood appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal appeared by video for Jerome Artrell Kirkwood.  Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Address verified. Acknowledges receipt, waives reading, requests prelim.  Court notes 5 trailing citations. Attorney enters pleas of not guilty. Citations to trail.
State requests $2000 cash, with conditions of no use or possession of controlled substances, no alcohol, no driving without valid license or permit. Notes out on cash bail in two other matters in Douglas County. Cites other prior matters in Minnesota, Illinois, Ohio and MIssissippi.
Attorney Rosenthal argues that bail was reduced in other matters. Lives in Douglas County, working on GED. Has made court appearances in other Douglas County matters. Asks for $500 cash.  
Court orders $1,000 cash, with conditions of no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription, no use or possession of alcohol, no operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.
